title: Philosophiæ Naturalis Principia Mathematica
summary: Philosophiæ Naturalis Principia Mathematica (Mathematical Principles of Natural Philosophy)[1] by Isaac Newton, often referred to as simply the Principia (/prɪnˈsɪpiə, prɪnˈkɪpiə/), is a work expounding Newton's laws of motion and his law of universal gravitation;  in three books written in Latin, first published 5 July 1687.[2][3]
